subclusters.subcluster_name: Oxidative Stress and Replicative Senescence Theory
Senescent Cell Anti-Apoptotic Pathways and Senolytic Therapy Theory
p16INK4a-Mediated Cellular Senescence and Tissue Dysfunction Theory

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage-Induced Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: This theory focuses on DNA damage response activation leading to cellular senescence and neurodegeneration, highlighting DNA damage as the primary trigger.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage-Induced Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: It centers on DNA damage response, cell fate decisions including senescence, and integrates these into a systems biology model linking DNA damage to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage-Induced Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: This theory emphasizes p53-mediated DNA damage response shifting balance from apoptosis to senescence, linking DNA damage and senescence accumulation to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage-Induced Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on stress-induced senescence driven by DNA damage and telomere shortening, with SASP and inflammaging as downstream effects.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage-Induced Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Caveolin-1 mediates stress-induced premature senescence via p53/p21 pathway, linking oxidative stress and DNA damage response to senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage-Induced Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes cell cycle arrest via p53-p21 and p16 pathways triggered by DNA damage and telomere shortening, with SASP and oxidative stress involvement.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage-Induced Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Although focused on autophagy impairment, it highlights telomere attrition and DNA damage as triggers of neuronal senescence, linking DNA damage to senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage-Induced Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Telomere attrition-induced senescence drives tau pathology and neuroinflammation, emphasizing DNA damage and telomere shortening as senescence triggers.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative Stress and Replicative Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on stress-induced premature senescence caused by oxidative stress (ROS), with mechanistic overlap to replicative senescence but emphasizing oxidative damage.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative Stress and Replicative Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Centers on replicative senescence driven by telomere shortening accelerated by oxidative stress, linking oxidative damage to cellular aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative Stress and Replicative Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes replicative senescence in T lymphocytes driven by telomere shortening and oxidative stress, with loss of CD28 as a senescence marker.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative Stress and Replicative Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Replicative senescence contributes to organismal aging, accelerated by physiological stress, emphasizing telomere shortening and oxidative damage.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative Stress and Replicative Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on limited proliferative potential of fibroblasts linked to telomere shortening and genetic regulation, modeling replicative senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative Stress and Replicative Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes replicative senescence-induced impaired myoblast differentiation, linking multiple population doublings and altered signaling to aging muscle.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative Stress and Replicative Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Premature cellular senescence in fibroblasts from accelerated aging mice, reflecting replicative senescence mechanisms contributing to systemic aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative Stress and Replicative Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Mathematical Penna model incorporating cellular senescence onset and replicative limits, modeling aging dynamics linked to replicative senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Endothelial Replicative Senescence and Regeneration Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on endothelial cell replicative senescence, Hayflick limit, and progenitor cell homing dynamics affecting endothelial aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescent Cell Anti-Apoptotic Pathways and Senolytic Therapy Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes senescent cells' resistance to apoptosis via Bcl-2 family proteins and therapeutic targeting by senolytic agents.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescent Cell Anti-Apoptotic Pathways and Senolytic Therapy Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on senescence as aging driver and senolytic interventions targeting senescent cells to alleviate age-related dysfunction.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescent Cell Anti-Apoptotic Pathways and Senolytic Therapy Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Senescent glial cells contribute to ALS pathology; senolytic treatment reduces senescence burden and improves function.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescent Cell Anti-Apoptotic Pathways and Senolytic Therapy Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights senescent cell heterogeneity, SASP, and interactions with immune cells influencing aging and pathology, relevant for senolytic targeting.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescent Cell Anti-Apoptotic Pathways and Senolytic Therapy Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: General hallmarks of senescence including apoptosis resistance and SASP, foundational for understanding senolytic targeting.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Developmental and Genetic Regulation of Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on early developmental genetic robustness, biomarkers of senescence, and gene-environment interactions influencing aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: p16INK4a-Mediated Cellular Senescence and Tissue Dysfunction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes p16INK4a accumulation causing senescence, barrier dysfunction, and microbial dysbiosis in intestinal epithelium.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: p16INK4a-Mediated Cellular Senescence and Tissue Dysfunction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Senescence drives osteoporosis via SASP and impaired bone remodeling, involving hormone deficiency and mesenchymal stem cell dysfunction.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: p16INK4a-Mediated Cellular Senescence and Tissue Dysfunction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Senescence acts as tumor suppressor early but promotes cancer via SASP and tissue environment changes later, illustrating antagonistic pleiotropy.
